trans-unit.resname: ME1·111 | Winds of Change | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·111 | Winds of Change | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "'Tis the set of sails and not the gales Which tells us the way to go."\n—Ella Wheeler Wilcox, "Winds of Fate"
Ydwen Efreet
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Whenever you're attacked, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Ydwen Efreet can't block this turn.
Autumn Willow
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Shroud {G}: Until end of turn, Autumn Willow can be the target of spells and abilities controlled by target player as though it didn't have shroud.
"We must shake her limbs and rattle her brains."\n—Grandmother Sengir
Play Berserk only before the combat damage step. Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. At end of turn, destroy that creature if it attacked this turn.
Defender
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."\n—Vervamon the Elder
Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

"Chub toad, chub toad
At the door.
Run away quick
Or you'll run no more."
—Traditional children's rhyme
Eureka
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Starting with you, each player may put a permanent card from his or her hand into play. Repeat this process until no one puts a card into play.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
"Living side by side with the elves for so long leaves me with no doubt that we serve the same goddess."\n—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
Gargantuan Gorilla
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Gargantuan Gorilla unless you sacrifice a Forest. If you sacrifice Gargantuan Gorilla this way, it deals 7 damage to you. If you sacrifice a snow Forest this way, Gargantuan Gorilla gains trample until end of turn. {T}: Gargantuan Gorilla deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Gargantuan Gorilla.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than any other, that player gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."\n—Murat, death speaker
Ice Storm
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Destroy target land.
Ifh-Bíff Efreet
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Flying {G}: Ifh-Bíff Efreet deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may play this ability.
Search your library for a Forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
"Fyndhorn is our home."\n—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands he or she controls.
"It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."\n—Daria
Vigilance Rabid Wombat gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
Enchant creature without flying When Roots comes into play, tap enchanted creature. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
"That which nourishes can also bind."\n—Gemma, Willow Priestess
Flying
The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.
Shambling Strider
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the striders' territory.
Singing Tree
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {T}: Target attacking creature's power becomes 0 until end of turn.
Spectral Bears
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
"I hear there are bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."\n—Gulsen, abbey matron
Storm Seeker
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Storm Seeker deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.
Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's power.
Thorn Thallid
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
"The danger in cultivating massive plants caught the elves by surprise."\n—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*
Tornado
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Cumulative upkeep {G} {2}{G}, Pay 3 life for each velocity counter on Tornado: Destroy target permanent and put a velocity counter on Tornado. Play this ability only once each turn.
Enchant creature At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!"\n—William Shakespeare, King Lear
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"\n—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary
Yavimaya Ants
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Trample, haste Cumulative upkeep {G}{G}
"Few natural forces are as devastating as hunger."\n—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order
Adun Oakenshield
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {B}{R}{G}, {T}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
". . . And at his passing, the bodies of the world's great warriors shall rise from their graves and follow him to battle."\n—The Anvilonian Grimoire
Centaur Archer
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {T}: Centaur Archer deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
"Centaurs will kill our aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."\n—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
Dakkon Blackblade
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Dakkon Blackblade's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
"My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins."\n—Dakkon Blackblade, Memoirs
Energy Arc
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Untap any number of target creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by those creatures this turn.
"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."\n—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
Fire Covenant
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: As an additional cost to play Fire Covenant, pay X life. Fire Covenant deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·146 | Hymn of Rebirth | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Hymn of Rebirth
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·146 | Hymn of Rebirth | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Put target creature card in a graveyard into play under your control.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·146 | Hymn of Rebirth | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."\n—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

trans-unit.resname: ME1·147 | Jacques le Vert | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Jacques le Vert
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·147 | Jacques le Vert | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Green creatures you control get +0/+2.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·147 | Jacques le Vert | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: Abandoning his sword to return to the lush forest of Pendelhaven, Jacques le Vert devoted his life to protecting the creatures of his homeland.
Lim-Dûl's Vault
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Look at the top five cards of your library. As many times as you choose, you may pay 1 life, put those cards on the bottom of your library, then look at the top five cards of your library. Then shuffle your library and put the last cards you looked at this way on top of it in any order.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·149 | Lord of Tresserhorn | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Lord of Tresserhorn
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·149 | Lord of Tresserhorn | Card Text
trans-unit.source: When Lord of Tresserhorn comes into play, you lose 2 life and sacrifice two creatures, and an opponent draws two cards. {B}: Regenerate Lord of Tresserhorn.
Phelddagrif
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {G}: Phelddagrif gains trample until end of turn. Target opponent puts a 1/1 green Hippo creature token into play. {W}: Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life. {U}: Return Phelddagrif to its owner's hand. Target opponent may draw a card.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·151 | Ankh of Mishra | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Whenever a land comes into play, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
{T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered them.

Clockwork Beast comes into play with seven +1/+0 counters on it. At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it. {X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
Copper Tablet
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.
As Cursed Rack comes into play, choose an opponent. The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.
Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.
{2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.
Forcefield
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {1}: The next time target unblocked creature would deal combat damage to you this turn, prevent all but 1 of that damage.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus four.
Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.
Mirror Universe
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Universe: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
Nevinyrral's Disk comes into play tapped. {1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
When Onulet is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 2 life.
An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·162 | Phyrexian War Beast | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Phyrexian War Beast
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·162 | Phyrexian War Beast | Card Text
trans-unit.source: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves play, sacrifice a land and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·162 | Phyrexian War Beast | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"\n—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

trans-unit.resname: ME1·163 | Ring of Ma'rûf | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Ring of Ma'rûf
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·163 | Ring of Ma'rûf | Card Text
trans-unit.source: {5}, {T}, Remove Ring of Ma'rûf from the game: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.

{4}, {T}: Put a 1/1 Snake artifact creature token into play. This creature has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter." (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

trans-unit.resname: ME1·165 | Shield of the Ages | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Shield of the Ages
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·165 | Shield of the Ages | Card Text
trans-unit.source: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·165 | Shield of the Ages | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."\n—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
Shield Sphere
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Defender Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.
"My soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."\n—King Darien of Kjeldor
Stone Calendar
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Spells you play cost up to {1} less to play.
The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.
Su-Chi
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: When Su-Chi is put into a graveyard from play, add {4} to your mana pool.
Flawed copies of relics from the Thran Empire, the su-chi were inherently unstable but provided useful knowledge for Tocasia's students.
Tawnos's Coffin
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Coffin during your untap step. {3}, {T}: Remove target creature and all Auras attached to it from the game. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature. When Tawnos's Coffin leaves play or becomes untapped, return the removed card to play under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it, and if you do, return the removed Aura cards to play under their owner's control attached to that permanent.
{T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Urza's Chalice
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Whenever a player plays an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.
Walking Wall
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Defender {3}: Walking Wall gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Play this ability only once each turn.
"The fortress is not what it seems."\n—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
Sacrifice a land: You gain 2 life.
"I will go to any length to achieve my goal. Eternal life is worth any sacrifice."\n—Zur the Enchanter
Diamond Valley
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·176 | Island of Wak-Wak | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Island of Wak-Wak
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·176 | Island of Wak-Wak | Card Text
trans-unit.source: {T}: The power of target creature with flying becomes 0 until end of turn.

trans-unit.resname: ME1·176 | Island of Wak-Wak | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: The Isle of Wak-Wak, home to a tribe of winged folk, is named for a peculiar fruit that grows there. The fruit looks like a woman's head, and when ripe speaks the word "Wak."

trans-unit.resname: ME1·177 | Lake of the Dead | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Lake of the Dead
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.resname: ME1·177 | Lake of the Dead | Card Text
trans-unit.source: If Lake of the Dead would come into play, sacrifice a Swamp instead. If you do, put Lake of the Dead into play. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard. {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land. {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Rainbow Vale
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. An opponent gains control of Rainbow Vale at end of turn.
In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of knights' quests.
Thawing Glaciers
trans-unit.note: 此牌名非官方翻译，需要校对！

trans-unit.source: Thawing Glaciers comes into play tapped. {1}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play tapped, then shuffle your library. Thawing Glaciers gains substance until end of turn. Return Thawing Glaciers to its owner's hand when it loses substance.
